info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 5:43PM MST until February 16 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO PORTIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLAINS... .A winter storm will bring snow, heavy at times, to most areas roughly along and south of I-70 through Wednesday evening. The heaviest snow is expected in the mountains surrounding Park County, the southern foothills, the Palmer Divide (including I-25 between Denver and Colorado Springs), and possibly portions of I-70 through the plains. Snow will be heaviest tonight into Wednesday morning, with lighter snow lingering much of the day on Wednesday. In addition, gusty winds will lead to localized blowing snow concerns. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO MIDNIGHT MST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 8 inches with the highest amounts in the foothills of Boulder County. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, southern Weld County, and Fort Morgan. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Midnight MST Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
